Kalittokai 94.
iḵtu “aṭiyōr pāṅkiṉum viṉaivalar pāṅkiṉum – kaṭivarai yilapuṟat teṉmaṉār pulavar” (to.po.23) eṉpataṉāl aṭiyō-rākiya kūṉuṅ kuṟaḷum uṟaḻntu kūṭik kūṟiyatu.
eṉṉōṟ ṟaṉaikollō
nīru ṇiḻaṟpō ṉuṭaṅkiya meṉcāya
līṅkuc curuṅki
yiyaluvāy niṉṉō ṭucāvuve ṉiṉṟīttai;
aṉṉaiyō, kāṇṭakai yillāk kuṟaṇāḻip pōtiṉā
ṉāṇṭalaik kīṉṟa paṟaḻmakaṉē nīyemmai
vēṇṭuva leṉṟu vilakkiṉai niṉpōlvār
tīṇṭap peṟupavō maṟṟu;
māṇṭai, eṟitta paṭaipōṉ muṭaṅki maṭaṅki
neṟittuviṭ ṭaṉṉa niṟaiyērā leṉṉaip
poṟukkallā nōyceytāy pōṟi niṟukkallē
ṉīnalki ṉuṇṭeṉ ṉuyir;
kuṟippukkāṇ vallup palakai yeṭuttu niṟuttaṉṉa
kallāk kuṟaḷa kaṭumpakal vantemmai
yillattu vāveṉa meykoḷīi yellāniṉ
peṇṭiruḷar maṉṉō kūṟu;
nallāykēḷ, ukkattu mēlu naṭuvuyarntu vāḷvāya
kokkurit taṉṉa koṭumaṭāy niṉṉaiyāṉ
pukkakalam pulliṉeñ cūṉṟum puṟampulli
ṉakkuḷuttup pullalu māṟṟē ṉaruḷīmō
pakkattup pullal ciṟitu;
pōcīttai,
makkaṇ muriyēnī māṟiṉit tokka
marakkōṭṭañ cērnteḻunta pūṅkoṭi pōla
nirappamil yākkai taḻīiya remmaip
purappēmeṉ pārum palarāṟ parattaiyeṉ
pakkattup pullīyā yeṉṉumāṟ ṟokka
vuḻuntiṉun tuvvāk kuṟuvaṭṭā niṉṉi
ṉiḻintatō kūṉiṉ piṟappu;
kaḻintāṅkē,
yāmvīḻtu meṉṟutaṉ piṉcelavu muṟṟīyāk
kūṉikuḻai yuṅkuḻaivu kāṇ;
yāmai, yeṭuttu niṟuttaṟṟāṟ ṟōḷiraṇṭum vīci
yāmvēṇṭē meṉṟu vilakkavu memvīḻuṅ
kāmar naṭakku naṭaikāṇ kavarkaṇaic
cāmaṉār tammuṉ celavu kāṇka;
ōokāṇ, nammu ṇakutaṟ ṟoṭīiyar nammuṇā
mucāaṅ kōṉaṭitoṭ ṭēṉ;
āṅkāka, cāyaliṉ mārpa vaṭaṅkiṉēṉ ēe
pēyum pēyun tuḷḷa luṟumeṉak
kōyiluṭ kaṇṭār nakāmai vēṇṭuval
taṇṭāt takaṭuruva vēṟākak kāviṉkīḻp
pōta rakaṭārap pulli muyaṅkuvēn
tukaṭīrpu kāṭci yavaiyattā rōlai
mukaṭukāp piyāttuviṭ ṭāṅku.
What penance have you done?
With a soft grace that sways like a shadow in water,
shrinking here,
you move forward. Let me ask [something] from you, stand!
Mother, dwarf not fit to be seen, chick brought forth by an man-head bird,
in the time of one Nāḻi, son, saying you want us
you have blocked [our way]. Do the likes of you
get to touch [me]?
You glorious one, [your] full beauty, like a weapon
that has been bent, folded [and] compressed, you
cause me pain I have not learned to bear. Bearing it I do not weigh.
If you grant [it, it] is my life.
See [that] intention! Like a gambling board lifted [and] balanced [on edge],
uneducated dwarf, coming in bright daylight, taking hold of my body,
saying [to us] “come to [my] house”, will all your
women be there [too], tell [me]?
Good girl, listen, being high in the middle all above the waist, with a sword mouth, there being a deep hole crooked like a skinned mango, if I enter you
[and] embrace your bosom/body, [my] heart leans on [it]. If I embrace [your] back, being tickled I cannot, as soon as I embrace. Grace [me]
with embracing from the side, a little bit.
Go, wretch.
Piece of a person, you get lost now. Many indeed will be those who say
of us we hold with embracing a body without fullness,
like a flower creeper that rises joining a bend of formed wood.
A courtesan! “Embrace my side”, he is saying indeed.
You more base than accumulated black gram, you short pawn,
is a hunchback birth as low as yours?
Hunchback woman
who does not suffer [our] going after her,
saying passing like that we would fall,
see [your way to] softening tenderness.
It is like lifting [and] balancing a tortoise.
See the gait with which the lecher walks
who falls on us although we obstruct [him],
flinging our two arms [and] saying “we don’t want [you].
Let us see the going of the elder brother of Śyāma with seizing arrows.
Oh, look: let [your] smiling touch our heart. We won’t
inquire with our heart. I have touched the feet of the king.
As it is thus, oh you with a chest pleasing in grace, I yield forthwith.
I want that those who see [us?] in the temple won’t smile,
saying “there is a demon leaping about with a demon.”
You of the form of an unattached metal plate, otherwise
come under the shelter! Inside we shall entwine [and] embrace fully,
like a palm-leaf of the insight[ful scholars] of the assembly,
firmly tied with the top protection after the dust is wiped off.
